channel.title: Lotro
channel.description: Anybody else play lord of the rings online? Downloaded it yesterday and loving it! I finished the introductory quests section and will be playing some more tonight add me : loveandpower

item.title: Lotro
item.dc:creator: @Aetoc Aetoc
item.description:
@Aetoc wrote:

I tried this but for some reason it felt like i was playing LOTR: War In The North and i hate that game, So it lead me to not continue playing this one but maybe i should give it another chance.

Read full topic

item.title: Lotro
item.dc:creator: @Carter2 Carter_
item.description:
@Carter2 wrote:

There’s not a lot of data being transferred by clicking a few buttons and sending a few packets. If I stream a YouTube video and host a server then it lags, but so long as I dedicate it to the server it’s fine. Honestly, 20 players is fine, 30 is my limit.

Read full topic

item.title: Lotro
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

^ I’m sorry but I am not about to believe that. A lot of the lag in servers come from the network itself.

Read full topic

item.title: Lotro
item.dc:creator: @Carter2 Carter_
item.description:
@Carter2 wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:11, topic:455130”][quote author=Carter_ link=topic=558002.msg4082375#msg4082375 date=1345485998]

yeah it is, it took about 2-3 hours on a 12 mb connection which isn’t bad. It’s like 8gb download

I’m on dial-up so looking at about a 12 hour download lol, no thanks.
[/quote]Where do you live? Where I live dial-up is outdated by a decade.[/quote]
Nothing to do with my location. It’s my only option and I’m grateful I even have the internet. Times are hard. It’s actually not as slow as you think, only when downloading/uploading is the time prolonged.

I’ve hosted a server on a dial-up with 20 players online and had less lag than a $250 dedi.

Read full topic

item.title: Lotro
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:11, topic:455130”][quote author=Carter_ link=topic=558002.msg4082375#msg4082375 date=1345485998]

yeah it is, it took about 2-3 hours on a 12 mb connection which isn’t bad. It’s like 8gb download

I’m on dial-up so looking at about a 12 hour download lol, no thanks.
[/quote]Where do you live? Where I live dial-up is outdated by a decade.[/quote]Dial up is still offered by several resellers such as local10, 10net, etc. It’s mostly resellers from AT&T or Earthlink/earthlink resellers.

You can still get dial up in Atlanta GA (one of the larger capitols of the u.s.)

Read full topic

Is it a free download?

item.title: Lotro
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

yes, there are shops as well.

I wouldn’t be surprised if there are player shops also but I can’t clarify that as I have only played one day. I finished the introductory thing then went to bed

It has pretty cool graphics as well. Only 512mb is needed to run the game. It runs fairly smoothly for me running only 256mb

Read full topic

item.title: Lotro
item.dc:creator: @Carter2 Carter_
item.description:
@Carter2 wrote:

Do you level up and acquire items etc.?

Read full topic

item.title: Lotro
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

It’s similar to forsaken world ( I think it uses a similar engine/same engine )

what it pretty much is it takes the lotr feel of it and makes you quest/battle that type of stuff. You get mounts like horses and stuff. You can choose where your from ( rohan etc ) its pretty much about getting reputation in middle earth via questing/becoming famous. It’s fairly fun.

Read full topic
